column3: 1  c. Crisco2  c. sugar4  eggs1  tsp. banana flavoring1/2  tsp. cherry flavoring2  c. mashed bananas4  c. flour2  tsp. soda  pinch of salt1/2  c. chopped maraschino cherries1/2  c. chocolate chips1/2  c. chopped walnuts
column4: Cream Crisco and sugar; add eggs and flavorings.  Beat well. Add mashed bananas.  Gradually add flour and dry ingredients. Remove beaters and stir in cherries  chocolate chips and nuts. Pour in 2 greased loaf pans.  Bake at 350° for 1 1/2 hours.

column3: 1 (3 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese1 (1 oz.)  square unsweetened chocolate or melted2  c. confectioners sugar  pinch of salt1/2  tsp. vanilla2 to 4  Tbsp. cream
column4: Work cream cheese with a spoon until very soft.  Blend in the cooled melted chocolate and gradually add the sugar  beating until smooth after each addition.  Add salt and vanilla and stir in enough cream to give a smooth spreading consistency.  Spread on cooled cake.  Makes enough for two 8-inch cake layers.

column3: 1/2  stick butter2/3  c. sugar1  egg2  c. sifted cake flour1  tsp. baking soda1/3  c. cocoa1  tsp. cinnamon1  c. buttermilk1  c. raisins3/4  c. chopped nuts
column4: Cream butter and sugar until light.  Beat in egg.  Sift dry ingredients together; add to creamed mixture alternately with buttermilk.  Stir in raisins and nuts.  Turn into a greased 9-inch loaf pan.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

column3: 1  c. pecan halves36  Kraft caramels4  oz. semi-sweet chocolate chips
column4: Place 3 pecan halves on a buttered aluminum foil-lined cookie sheet.  Put a caramel on each group of pecans.  Put in a 350° oven for 10 minutes.  Remove from oven; flatten the caramels with a lightly buttered spoon.  Cover with melted chocolate (melt in double boiler) and place in refrigerator until hard.  These are delicious!!

column3: 1  tsp. vanilla2  sticks margarine2  egg yolks1/2  c. brown sugar2  c. flour1/2  tsp. salt  maraschino cherries
column4: Mix first 6 ingredients and roll dough into small balls (about 3 dozen)  then put thumbprint into center of ball.  Put cherry into thumbprint.  Bake at 350° for 8 to 10 minutes.

column3: 1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese or softened1/4  c. butter or margarine or softened1  pkg. Betty Crocker SuperMoist lemon cake mix1  egg1/4  tsp. vanilla1/2  c. flaked coconut or chopped nuts (optional)
column4: Heat oven to 375°.  Beat cream cheese and butter until light and fluffy.  Mix in about half of the cake mix  egg and vanilla until smooth.  Stir in remaining cake mix and the coconut or nuts. Drop by teaspoonfuls about 2-inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet.  Bake 10 to 12 minutes.  Cool slightly; remove from cookie sheet.  Makes about 5 dozen cookies.

column3: 2  eggs3/4  c. sugar1/3  c. flour1/4  tsp. baking powder1/8  tsp. salt1  tsp. vanilla1/2  tsp. grated lemon rind1  c. dates or pecans2 2/3  c. coconut1  Tbsp. butter or melted
column4: Beat eggs; add sugar slowly while beating.  Add remaining ingredients  adding melted butter last.  Drop by teaspoon onto greased and floured baking sheet.  Bake about 15 minutes in a 325° oven.

column3: 2  sticks butter or oleo1  c. sugar2  c. flour1 or 2  tsp. cinnamon1  egg or separated1 1/2  c. chopped pecans
column4: Cream butter  egg yolk and sugar.  Add cinnamon to flour; add to creamed mixture  beating well.  Press half of dough on 15 x 11-inch cookie sheet as thin as possible.  Brush with unbeaten egg white; sprinkle with pecans.  Repeat with remaining dough.  Bake at 325° for 10 to 15 minutes or until golden brown.  Cut in squares while hot.

column3: 1 (11 1/2 oz.)  pkg. (2 c.)  Nestle milk chocolate morsels1/4  c. sour cream2 measuring  Tbsp. almond flavored liqueur2/3  c. finely chopped toasted almonds
column4: Melt over hot  not boiling  water the Nestle milk chocolate morsels.  Stir until smooth.  Remove from heat.  Blend in sour cream.  Add almond flavored liqueur; mix well.  Transfer to small bowl.  Chill until firm.  Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper-lined cookie sheets.  Shape into balls.  Roll in almonds until evenly coated.  Chill until firm.  Makes about 2 1/2 dozen truffles.

column3: 2  c. cold milk1/4  c. chocolate syrup1/4  c. malted milk powder4  scoops chocolate or vanilla ice cream
column4: Pour milk  chocolate syrup and malted milk powder into blender container.  Cover and blend until frothy  about 15 seconds.  Add the ice cream while motor is running.  Blend only until mixed. Yields about 3 cups.

column3: 2 (3 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese4  c. confectioners sugar or sifted1  Tbsp. heavy cream1  tsp. brandy extract1/2  tsp. salt1/4  tsp. cinnamon1/8  tsp. nutmeg1/2  c. Nestle Toll House semi-sweet chocolate morsels1 1/4  c. finely chopped pecans
column4: In bowl  beat cream cheese  sugar  cream  brandy extract  salt  cinnamon and nutmeg until creamy.  Stir in Toll House semi-sweet morsels.  Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto cookie sheet; chill 5 minutes.  Roll into balls and roll in the nuts.  Makes 3 dozen balls.

column3: 1  c. light cream1  c. butter2  c. sugar3/4  c. light corn syrup1/2  tsp. salt3  oz. (3 sq.) unsweetened chocolate1/8  tsp. cream of tartar2  tsp. vanilla  almonds or pecans or walnuts (if desired)
column4: Combine first 7 ingredients in heavy saucepan.  Cook over low heat  stirring constantly  until sugar dissolves.  Cook until candy forms a firm ball in cold water (245° on candy thermometer). Remove from heat.  Stir in vanilla.  Pour in a 9 x 9 x 2-inch pan. Do not scrape pan.  Nuts can be pressed into top  if desired.  Let cool.  Cut into 3/4-inch squares.  Let dry.  Wrap.  Makes 144 caramels.

column3: 2  c. sugar1  stick butter2  Tbsp. white syrup3 heaping  tsp. cocoa1 small  can Carnation milk
column4: Mix all ingredients well.  Cook over low heat until forms a soft ball in water or to the soft ball stage on a candy thermometer.  Remove from heat and stir until cool.

column3: 3  c. Rice Krispies1  c. shredded coconut1/3  c. light corn syrup1/2  c. brown sugar1  tsp. vanilla
column4: Combine cereal and coconut in bowl.  Combine other ingredients in saucepot and bring to a boil while stirring.  Remove from heat. Stir in cereal mixture.  Let cool  shape into bird's nests.  Fill with "jelly bean eggs".

column3: 1 1/2  c. semi-sweet morsels1/3  c. butter1 1/2  c. flour1  tsp. baking soda1/4  tsp. salt1  c. chopped Macadamia nuts2/3  c. sour cream1/4  c. corn syrup1  egg
column4: Preheat oven to 375°.  Combine over hot (not boiling) water  semi-sweet morsels and butter.  Stir until morsels are melted and mixture is smooth; set aside.  In a large bowl  combine flour  baking soda and salt.  Add nuts to coat well.  Make a well in the center of flour mixture.  In a small bowl  combine melted morsels  sour cream  corn syrup and egg until blended.  Add to dry ingredients; stir until just moistened.  Spoon into paper-lined muffin pans  filling each about 3/4 full.  Bake for 15 to 18 minutes.  Cool 5 minutes; remove from pans.  Cool completely or serve warm.  Makes about 15 muffins.

column3: 1/3  c. butter1/2  c. sugar1  egg  grated rind of 1/2 lemon1  c. flour1/3 level  tsp. salt1 level  tsp. baking powder
column4: Beat the butter and sugar to a creamy mixture.  Add the beaten egg and lemon rind.  Sift dry ingredients together and add.  Drop by spoonfuls on a greased pan and bake about 10 minutes at 350°.

column3: 3  c. dairy egg nog1  c. chocolate milk1/2  c. creme de cacao1  c. whipped cream  shaved chocolate
column4: Mix and chill egg nog  chocolate milk and creme de cacao.  When ready to serve  stir in whipped cream.  Garnish with shaved chocolate.  Makes ten 1/2-cup servings.

column3: 1  c. soft butter1 1/2  tsp. vanilla1  tsp. salt1  c. sugar2  c. flour or sifted12  oz. semi-sweet chocolate morsels1  c. finely chopped walnuts
column4: Combine butter  vanilla and salt and blend well.  Gradually beat in sugar.  Add flour  chocolate pieces and 3/4 cup walnuts; mix well.  Press evenly in ungreased 15 x 10 x 1-inch pan. Sprinkle remaining 1/4 cup walnuts over top and press in lightly. Bake at 375° for 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool  then break into pieces or cut into bars.  Makes 1 3/4 pounds.

column3: 1 1/2  c. flour1/2  tsp. each: soda and salt2/3  c. brown sugar1/2  c. shortening1  unbeaten egg1/4  c. maraschino cherry juice2  Tbsp. milk2  sq. (2 oz.) unsweetened chocolate or melted1/2  c. chopped walnuts1/4  c. maraschino cherries or chopped18  marshmallows or cut in half2  Tbsp. butter2  blocks Hershey's chocolate3  Tbsp. milk1 1/2  c. confectioners sugar1/2  tsp. vanilla  pinch of salt
column4: Sift together first 3 ingredients; set aside.  Add brown sugar to shortening.  Blend in egg.  Stir in half the dry ingredients. Add cherry juice and 2 tablespoons milk; stir in remaining dry ingredients.  Mix well.  Blend in chocolate  walnuts and cherries. Drop by rounded teaspoonful onto ungreased cookie sheet.  Bake at 350° for 12 to 15 minutes.  Cut marshmallows in half and place on hot cookies.      For Icing:  Melt butter and chocolate in top of double boiler; stir until blended.  Stir 3 tablespoons milk into sugar and beat until smooth.  Add vanilla  pinch of salt and chocolate mixture. Beat until smooth and thickened.  Frost cookies; top with nut halves.

column3: 1  lb. butter or softened1 1/4  c. confectioners sugar or sifted4  c. cake flour2  c. hickory nuts (the more the better)3/4  Tbsp. vanilla
column4: Cream butter and sugar.  Stir in flour  nuts and vanilla.  Mix well.  Shape in 1-inch balls.  Bake 15 to 20 minutes at 325°.

column3: 1  Tbsp. butter3/8  c. granulated sugar1  egg1  c. flour1  tsp. baking powder  sprinkle of salt1  tsp. vanilla1  c. well-washed currants
column4: Combine first 7 ingredients; mix well.  Stir in currants.  This dough is very soft.  It's a good idea to chill it.  Divide into sections and roll thin.  Cut.  Grease electric frypan lightly.  Set at 250° and bake 5 minutes on each side.  Be careful because they burn easily.

column3: 2  egg whites3/4  c. brown sugar or firmly packed  pinch of salt2  c. pecans
column4: Beat egg whites at room temperature until stiff peaks form. Gradually add sugar  beating until well blended.  Fold in remaining ingredients.  Drop by teaspoon onto greased cookie sheet.  Bake at 250° for 30 minutes.

column3: 2 1/2  c. flour1/2  tsp. baking powder1/2  tsp. salt1  tsp. soda1/2  c. butter1 1/2  c. brown sugar2  eggs1  tsp. vanilla1  c. sour cream1  c. chopped nuts2 (6 oz.)  pkg. chocolate chips
column4: Sift together:  flour  baking powder  salt and soda.  Cream butter and brown sugar.  Add eggs and vanilla to butter and sugar mixture.  Add sour cream  chopped nuts and chocolate chips.  Add sifted dry ingredients.  Bake at 375° until lightly browned.

column3: 1  c. butter1  c. sugar2  egg yolks2  c. flour1  c. nuts or finely chopped1/2 to 3/4  c. jam
column4: Cream butter and sugar until smooth.  Add egg yolks; mix until blended.  Slowly add flour and nuts; mix until blended.  Spoon 1/2 of the nut mixture into 8-inch square pan; spread evenly.  Cover mixture in pan with jam and pat remaining mixture over jam  covering jam completely.  Put in a cold oven; turn oven on to 325° and bake for 1 hour.

column3: 2/3  c. butter2  c. quick oats1  c. sugar2/3  c. flour1/4  c. light corn syrup1/4  c. milk1  tsp. vanilla1  (11 1/2 oz.) chocolate morsels
column4: Melt butter in saucepan.  In bowl  mix butter  oats  sugar  flour  corn syrup  milk and vanilla until well blended.  Drop by level teaspoon  3 inches apart onto foil-covered cookie sheets. Spread thin with a spatula.  Bake at 375° for 5 to 7 minutes.  Melt chocolate morsels over hot water.  Spread chocolate onto the flat side of one cookie.  Add another cookie to top to make a sandwich.

column3: 1 1/4  c. sugar1/2  c. cocoa3/4  c. light corn syrup2  tsp. cider vinegar1/8  tsp. salt2  Tbsp. butter1/4  c. cream2  qt. popped corn
column4: Combine sugar  cocoa  corn syrup  vinegar and salt in saucepan. Add butter; cook over low heat  stirring constantly until comes to boil.  Add cream; cook to hard ball stage.  Stir into popcorn. Butter hands and roll into balls.

column3: 1 2/3  c. flour1  Tbsp. pumpkin pie spice1  tsp. baking soda3/4  tsp. salt1/4  tsp. baking powder1 1/2  c. sugar1/2  c. oil2  eggs1  c. canned pumpkin1  c. chocolate chips1/2  c. toasted almonds
column4: Mix flour  spice  soda  salt and baking powder.  Beat sugar  oil and eggs in a large bowl.  Beat in pumpkin and 1/3 cup water. Stir in flour mixture  then chocolate chips and nuts.  Scrape into greased 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan.  Bake at 350° for about 70 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.  Cool in pan for 15 minutes.  Turn out on wire rack and cool completely. Freezes well.

column3: 1  c. melted butter2  c. brown sugar2  eggs1  tsp. vanilla1  tsp. salt2  c. flour
column4: Cream melted butter and brown sugar.  Add eggs  vanilla  salt and flour.  Mix well.  Pat onto a greased and floured cookie sheet. Bake at 300° for 25 to 30 minutes.  Cool and cut into squares.

column3: 1/3  c. granulated sugar1/3  c. packed brown sugar2  c. all-purpose flour2  tsp. baking powder1/2  tsp. salt2/3  c. milk1/2  c. (1 stick) unsalted butter or melted and cooled2  eggs or lightly beaten1 1/2  tsp. vanilla6  oz. (1 c.) milk chocolate chips6  oz. (1 c.) semi-sweet chocolate chips1/2  c. chopped nuts
column4: In a large bowl  stir together sugars  flour  baking powder and salt.  In another bowl mix together milk  butter  eggs and vanilla until blended.  Make a well in center of dry ingredients.  Add milk mixture and stir to combine.  Stir in chips and nuts.  Spoon batter into greased muffin cups; grease the edges around cups.  Bake in 400° oven for 15 to 20 minutes or until a cake tester comes out clean.  Remove muffins from oven and cool 5 minutes.  Remove from pans and cool on rack.  Serve warm or cold.  Makes 12 large muffins.

column3: 1 (16 oz.)  box instant chocolate powder1 (8 qt.)  box powdered milk1 (6 oz.)  jar powdered cream1/2  c. powdered sugar
column4: Combine all ingredients and mix well.  Store in airtight container.  To serve:  Use 1/3 cup mix to 1 cup hot water.

column3: 6  oz. semi-sweet chocolate chips6  oz. butterscotch chips2  Tbsp. peanut butter2  c. Spanish peanuts
column4: Melt chips and peanut butter over low heat.  Add 2 cups Spanish peanuts.  Drop by spoonfuls on waxed paper.  Let sit in refrigerator about 30 minutes.  Can store at room temperature.

column3: 12  beaten eggs2  lb. brown sugar4  c. sugar1  Tbsp. brown syrup (or white)8  tsp. soda1  lb. oleo3  lb. crunchy peanut butter18  c. oatmeal1  Tbsp. vanilla1  lb. chocolate chips1  lb. M&M's candy
column4: Mix in order given:  eggs  brown sugar  sugar  syrup  soda  oleo  peanut butter  oatmeal  vanilla  chocolate chips and M&M's. Drop on a cookie sheet with a large spoon and then flatten batter with a fork.  Bake for 13 minutes at 350°.

column3: 1  c. soft butter1/2  c. powdered sugar1  tsp. vanilla1/2  tsp. almond extract2 1/4  c. flour1/4  tsp. salt3/4  c. ground almonds  powdered sugar (for coating)
column4: Mix butter  1/2 cup powdered sugar and flavorings.  Mix at medium speed for 2 minutes.  Turn to low and add flour and salt. Beat until smooth.  Add almonds and blend.  Drop by teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet.  Shape into crescents.  Bake 8 minutes at 400°.  While warm  shake in bag of powdered sugar to coat.

column3: 1  large angel food cake1  pkg. vanilla pudding mix1 medium  can pineapple bits1  pt. all-purpose cream
column4: Mix undrained pineapple and contents of pudding in saucepan (use no milk).  Cook over low heat just until it thickens.  Let cool.  Beat cream until thick and fold into pineapple mix.  Cut cake into 4 layers.  Put layers together with pineapple mix and frost top and sides.  Garnish with cherries and mint leaves.

column3: 1 2/3  c. flour1 1/2  c. sugar1/2  tsp. salt2  tsp. pumpkin spice1  tsp. baking soda1/4  tsp. baking powder1  c. canned pumpkin1/2  c. vegetable oil1/2  c. water2  eggs1  c. chocolate chips1/2  c. chopped nuts
column4: In a large bowl  combine flour  sugar  salt  spice  baking soda and baking powder.  Add pumpkin  oil  water and eggs.  Beat to blend thoroughly.  Stir in chocolate chips and nuts.  Spoon into greased loaf pan.  Level top.  Bake at 350° for one hour until loaf is lightly browned and springy to touch.  Cool.

column3: 1  c. Crisco3/4  c. brown sugar3/4  c. white sugar2  large eggs2  c. sifted all-purpose flour1/4  tsp. salt1  tsp. baking powder1  tsp. baking soda2  c. oatmeal1  tsp. vanilla3/4  c. nutmeats (optional)1  c. chopped gumdrops (miniature)
column4: Cream together Crisco  brown and white sugars well.  Add eggs. Beat well.  Sift dry ingredients together and add to creamed mixture.  Add flavoring  nuts (optional) and gumdrops.  Mix well. Drop by teaspoons on greased cookie sheet.  Bake 10 minutes at 350°.  Yields 8 dozen.

column3: 2  c. sugar1/2  c. water1/2  c. light corn syrup1/8  tsp. salt2  egg whites or unbeaten1  tsp. vanilla1 (6 oz.)  pkg. semi-sweet chocolate pieces
column4: Combine sugar  water  syrup and salt in a heavy saucepan.  Cook over low heat  stirring constantly until sugar is dissolved.  Cook to hard ball stage (252°) without stirring.  Beat egg whites until stiff.  Pour hot syrup slowly over egg whites  beating constantly. Add vanilla; continue beating until mixture loses gloss and will hold shape.  Fold in chocolate bits quickly; drop from teaspoon onto buttered waxed paper.

column3: 12  small tart or crisp apples1  c. margarine1 (16 oz.)  pkg. brown sugar  pinch of salt1  c. light corn syrup1 (14 oz.)  can sweetened condensed milk2  sq. unsweetened chocolate1  tsp. vanilla1  c. chopped peanuts
column4: You will need 12 wooden skewers.      Butter a baking sheet.  Set aside.  Wash and dry apples; remove stems.  Insert skewer into stem end of each apple.  In heavy 3-quart saucepan  melt margarine.  Stir in brown sugar and salt. Add corn syrup and mix well.  Gradually stir in milk.  Add chocolate.  Cook over medium heat  stirring constantly  12 to 15 minutes until candy thermometer registers 245° (firm ball stage). Remove from heat.  Stir in vanilla.      Dip each apple into chocolate mixture  turning to coat.  With narrow spatula  scrape excess caramel from bottom of apple and let drip back into pan.  Immediately dip bottom halves of apples in chopped peanuts.  Set on buttered baking sheet to cool.  Makes 12 chocolate caramel apples.

column3: 3 1/4  c. all-purpose flour2  tsp. baking powder1/2  tsp. salt2  eggs or beaten1  c. sugar1  tsp. vanilla2/3  c. milk1/4  c. butter or margarine or melted1  sq. unsweetened chocolate or melted and cooled  shortening or cooking oil for frying
column4: Stir together first 3 ingredients.  In a large bowl  beat eggs  sugar and vanilla until thick.  Combine milk  melted butter and melted chocolate.  Add flour mixture and milk mixture alternately to egg mixture.  Beat until just blended after each addition. Cover and chill 2 hours.  On lightly floured surface  roll dough to 1/2-inch thickness.  Cut with doughnut cutter.  Fry in deep fat at 375° for about 1 minute per side  turning once.      For a chocolate glaze  melt chocolate and butter.  Stir in powdered sugar and vanilla.  Add enough boiling water to make of drizzling consistency.

column3: 2  eggs1/2  c. vegetable oil1  c. brown sugar1/2  tsp. vanilla1 1/2  c. grated zucchini1  sq. unsweetened chocolate or melted2  c. flour1/2  tsp. salt1/2  tsp. soda1/8  tsp. baking powder1/2  tsp. cinnamon1/2  tsp. pumpkin pie spice1/4  c. chopped nuts
column4: Beat eggs; add oil and brown sugar and beat well.  Add vanilla  zucchini and chocolate.  Beat.  Mix dry ingredients together and add to first mixture.  Add nuts and beat well.  Bake in standard loaf pan at 350° for 55 to 60 minutes.  Cool in pan until bread will remove easily  then cool on rack.

column3: 1  (8 oz.)  Velveeta cheese1  c. butter1/2  c. cocoa2  tsp. vanilla2  lb. powdered sugar1  c. nuts (optional)
column4: Heat cheese and butter on low heat until melted or microwave for 3 to 4 minutes.  Add cocoa  vanilla  powdered sugar and nuts. Mix well.  Mixture will be very thick.  Press into 9 x 13-inch pan. Chill.  No cooking and very delicious.

column3: 1  c. sugar1/2  c. shortening1  egg1/3  c. molasses1  tsp. cinnamon1/4  tsp. cloves1/4  tsp. nutmeg1/2  tsp. salt1 1/2  tsp. soda2  c. flour
column4: Cream sugar and shortening.  Add egg and molasses.  Then sift remaining dry ingredients and add.  Roll into walnut-size balls. Roll in sugar and place on greased cookie sheet.  Bake at 325° for 15 minutes.  Makes 1 dozen.

column3: 2 1/2  c. flour1 1/2  tsp. baking powder1/2  tsp. salt1  tsp. cinnamon1  c. sugar3/4  c. oil2  eggs or beaten1  tsp. vanilla
column4: Preheat oven to 375°.  Sift flour  baking powder  salt and cinnamon together.  Put sugar and oil in mixing bowl; mix well. Add eggs  then vanilla.  Add flour mixture all at once; beat well. Shape into 1/2-inch balls; roll in sugar.  Place on lightly greased baking sheets.  Flatten with fork; sprinkle with sugar.  Bake 10 to 12 minutes.  Remove to cooling trays.  Yields about 50.

column3: 1  c. sugar2  Tbsp. cocoa1/2  stick butter1 small  can Pet milk1/2  tsp. vanilla
column4: Mix sugar and cocoa on the stove for 1 minute.  Add 1/2 stick butter.  When melted add 1 small can of Pet milk and boil for 2 minutes.  Add 1/2 teaspoon vanilla.  Good served with plain cake and vanilla ice cream.

column3: 1/2  c. butter1  c. light brown sugar or packed1  egg1  tsp. vanilla extract3/4  tsp. black walnut flavoring1 1/2  c. flour1/2  tsp. soda1/4  tsp. salt1/2  c. black walnuts
column4: Cream butter.  Add sugar gradually.  Cream until light and fluffy.  Add egg  extract and black walnut flavoring.  Beat well. Sift flour  soda and salt together.  Add to creamed mixture.  Add black walnuts and blend.  Drop by teaspoonfuls onto greased cookie sheets.  Bake at 350° for 10 minutes.  Makes 5 dozen (2-inch) cookies.

column3: 35  large marshmallows or divided1 (12 oz.)  pkg. chocolate chips (semi-sweet)1/2  lb. margarine4  c. sugar1 1/2  c. evaporated milk1  tsp. vanilla2  c. chopped walnuts
column4: Cut 15 marshmallows into fourths and put on a tray in the freezer.  In a large glass bowl  cut the margarine into the chocolate chips.  Set aside.      Bring to a boil the sugar  milk and 20 whole marshmallows. Boil rapidly for 5 full minutes  stirring constantly.  Pour over butter and chip mixture.  Stir until it starts to thicken.  Add vanilla and nuts.  Add frozen marshmallow pieces and mix a little. Pour into a buttered pan and place in refrigerator until set.

column3: 2  boxes confectioners sugar1  can sweetened condensed milk1  stick butter or margarine1  can flaked coconut1 to 4  c. chopped pecans (more or less or none)  pinch of salt2  pkg. chocolate chips or semi-sweet chocolate or German's sweet chocolate1  stick or 1 block paraffin (1/4 lb.)
column4: Melt butter slowly and add milk.  Stir in sugar and salt.  Add coconut and pecans.  Chill until it can be easily handled.  Roll into balls.  Place in refrigerator or freezer until firm.  Melt chocolate and paraffin together in top of double boiler.  Remove from heat and dip each candy ball in chocolate  using toothpick. Remove candy from chocolate quickly and place on wax paper.  Use another toothpick to push ball from inserted toothpick.  If hole remains where toothpick was inserted  smooth with spoon and a small amount of coating.  Keep refrigerated.

column3: 1 (6 oz.)  pkg. semi-sweet chocolate morsels1/4  c. dark corn syrup2  Tbsp. powdered sugar1 1/2  tsp. vanilla extract2  c. raisins
column4: Combine chocolate morsels and corn syrup in top of double boiler.  Bring water to a boil; reduce heat to low.  Cook until chocolate melts  stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and stir in powdered sugar  vanilla and raisins.  Drop by half teaspoons into waxed paper.  Chill and store in refrigerator.  Makes about 5 1/2 dozen.

column3: 1/2  c. butter1/2  c. lard1  c. sugar1  egg1  tsp. vanilla flavoring2  c. flour1/2  tsp. baking soda1/2  tsp. cream of tartar
column4: Cream butter and lard.  Add sugar and cream together thoroughly.  Add egg and vanilla.  Mix dry ingredients and sift in a little at a time.  Roll into small balls and flatten with fork. Bake in 350° oven until slightly brown.  Makes 48 cookies.

column3: 1/2  c. Crisco1/2  c. butter1  c. powdered sugar1  egg1 1/2  tsp. vanilla flavoring or peppermint2 1/2  c. flour1/2  tsp. red food coloring
column4: Preheat oven to 375°.  Mix shortening  butter  sugar  egg and flavoring.  Add flour and mix.  Divide dough in half and add red food coloring to half of dough.  Roll a 4-inch strip using 1 teaspoon dough from each color.  Twist together and shape like a candy cane.  Sprinkle with granulated sugar.  Bake 10 minutes on ungreased baking sheet.

column3: 1  c. sugar1 1/2  c. dates (1 pkg.) or cut up2  eggs2  c. Rice Krispies  pinch of salt3/4  c. chopped nuts
column4: Put sugar  dates and eggs in greased frying pan.  Stir constantly  7 to 10 minutes  mashing dates as you stir.  Add remaining ingredients.  Stir into mixture until well mixed.  Start pan on hot.  When hot  turn to low.  When all is mixed  turn out on wax paper.  On another sheet of wax paper  empty can of Angel Flake coconut.  As soon as mixture is cool enough to handle  grease hands and form balls  fingers or any other shape you might want.  Roll in coconut.

column3: 2  eggs1  c. milk1 3/4  c. unsifted all-purpose flour2  Tbsp. sugar1  tsp. baking powder1/4  tsp. salt  dash of cinnamon (1/4 tsp. at least)  vegetable oil  confectioners sugar
column4: Beat eggs.  Beat in milk gradually.  (You will need to add more milk to make it as thin as pancake batter.)  Add flour  sugar  baking powder  salt and cinnamon.  Beat until smooth.  Cook in skillet 3/4 full of hot oil.  Cook until that side is done.  Turn and cook the other side.  Remove and drain well.  Sprinkle with confectioners sugar.

column3: 2  c. sugar3  Tbsp. cocoa1/2  c. milk1/4  lb. margarine1  tsp. vanilla1/2  c. crunchy peanut butter  pinch of salt3  c. quick-cooking oats
column4: Combine sugar  cocoa  milk and butter in saucepan; cook at full rolling boil for 1 minute.  Remove from heat.  Add vanilla  peanut butter and salt.  Mix well.  Add oats.  Drop by teaspoons on waxed paper and cool until firm.  Makes 4 dozen.

column3: 2  eggs2  c. powdered sugar1  tsp. vanilla  dash of salt1  c. chopped nuts4  c. miniature marshmallows (large size pkg.)2  sq. chocolate or melted and cooled2  Tbsp. melted butter  grated coconut
column4: Beat eggs until fluffy and lemon colored.  Add slowly the powdered sugar  vanilla and salt.  Stir in nuts and marshmallows. Add cooled chocolate and butter.  Have fine grated coconut in a bowl.  Drop cookies into coconut and roll until covered.  Set aside to firm and set.  These are very rich.

column3: 2  egg whites3/4  c. sugar1/2  tsp. cream of tartar  dash of salt1  tsp. creme de menthe6  oz. chocolate chips  green food coloring
column4: Preheat oven to 375°.  Combine first 4 ingredients and beat until stiff.  Fold in remaining ingredients.  Drop by teaspoonfuls on foil-covered cookie sheets.  Turn oven off and leave cookies in oven overnight.  Store in tins between wax paper.  May be frozen.

column3: 1 (11 oz.)  pkg. spice cake mix1  c. canned pumpkin1/2  c. salad oil3  eggs1 (3 3/4 oz.)  pkg. instant vanilla pudding1 1/2  tsp. cinnamon1/2  c. water1  c. chopped pecans
column4: Preheat oven to 350°.  Combine all ingredients  except pecans. Beat at medium speed 5 minutes.  Add nuts and mix well; pour batter into well-greased and floured Bundt pan.  Bake 40 to 50 minutes. Let cool in pan 10 minutes  then loosen center and sides with plastic spatula.  Invert and tip on wire rack to cool.  Can ice with cream cheese icing or use Cool Whip to serve.

column3: 1/2  c. butter1  Tbsp. lard1  c. sugar1/4  tsp. salt1  tsp. cinnamon1/2  c. (scant) cocoa1  egg or well beaten1/2  tsp. soda2  Tbsp. milk2 to 2 1/2  c. flour
column4: Beat until creamy the butter and lard.  Gradually beat sugar into this.  Then add salt  cinnamon and melted cocoa.  Add well beaten egg.  Add soda dissolved in milk.  Stir in about 2 to 2 1/2 cups flour.  Roll 1/8-inch thick.  Cut with round cutter.  Bake in quick oven.  Use as little flour as possible for rolling.  Frost after cooled with buttercream frosting  putting two cookies together like a sandwich.

column3: 1  c. butter or margarine or softened1/2  c. sugar1  tsp. vanilla1/4  tsp. salt2  c. flour  confectioners sugar
column4: Preheat oven to 375°.  Cream butter  1/2 cup sugar  vanilla and salt until fluffy.  Stir in flour until well blended.  Chill 30 minutes or until firm enough to handle.  Shape in 1-inch balls. Place 1 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheet and bake until light golden  12 to 15 minutes.  Remove to rack while cookies are still warm; sift heavily with confectioners sugar.  Cool  then store airtight in cool  dry place.  Before serving  sift cookies with more confectioners sugar.  Makes about 48 cookies.

column3: 3  eggs2/3  c. sugar1/4  tsp. salt3/4  c. Karo (light or dark)1/4  c. maple syrup1/3  c. butter or margarine2  c. chopped walnuts1  unbaked pie shell
column4: Beat eggs thoroughly with sugar  salt  corn syrup  maple syrup and melted butter or margarine.  Add chopped walnuts and mix thoroughly.  Pour into unbaked pie shell.  Bake at 350° for 50 minutes or until knife inserted comes out clean.  Cool completely before cutting.  Serve with whipped cream.

column3: 1/2  lb. butter  dash of salt1/2  c. powdered sugar1/2  tsp. vanilla2  c. flour1  c. chopped pecans
column4: Cream butter  salt and sugar.  Add other ingredients and roll into 1-inch balls.  Bake at 325° to 350° for about 20 minutes. They will not be brown.  While hot  roll in powdered sugar.  If preferred  when cooled  roll in powdered sugar again.

column3: 2  sticks margarine1  c. sugar1  egg or separated2  c. flour2  tsp. cinnamon1  c. nuts
column4: Cream margarine  sugar and egg yolk; beat well.  Add flour and cinnamon; mix well.  Beat egg white until foamy; spread batter thin on cookie sheet.  Brush egg white on top; sprinkle with chopped nuts.  Bake at 300° for 25 to 30 minutes.  When done  remove from cookie sheet at once.

column3: 2 1/2  c. flour3/4  c. Hershey's cocoa1  tsp. baking soda1  c. sugar1  c. brown sugar1  c. butter1  tsp. vanilla2  eggs48  Rolo caramels1  c. Macadamia nuts or chopped fine1  Tbsp. sugar
column4: Blend dry ingredients.  Cream white sugar  brown sugar and butter; add vanilla.  Add eggs.  Add dry ingredients to wet ingredients.  Wrap dough around Rolo candy.  Roll in chopped nuts and sugar.  Bake 1-inch apart on ungreased cookie sheet at 375° for 7 to 10 minutes.

column3: 6  oz. butter8  oz. caster sugar12  oz. plain or self-rising flour1  egg or well beaten2  Tbsp. strong black coffee1  Tbsp. rum2  tsp. baking powder (if using plain flour)1/2  tsp. salt3  oz. blanched nuts (cashews or almonds or peanuts) or chopped
column4: Cream the butter and sugar.  Add 3 tablespoons flour to the egg  then beat in the coffee and rum.  Add this to the butter and sugar mixture and continue beating until it is a soft batter.  Sift the remaining flour with the baking powder  if used  and salt and add very slowly to the batter.  Stir in the chopped nuts  adding a little extra flour if the dough is not stiff enough to roll out. Refrigerate for 1 hour  then flour a board and roll out to 1/4-inch thickness and cut into desired shapes.  Bake on an ungreased baking sheet in a moderately hot oven (375°) for 10 to 15 minutes until cookies are firm and pale beige.

column3: 3 1/2  c. sugar1  c. shortening1 1/2  tsp. cinnamon3/4  tsp. cloves3/4  tsp. ginger3/4  tsp. allspice2  tsp. salt2  Tbsp. baking soda1  c. dark molasses5  c. flour1/2  c. water  sugar  strawberry or raspberry jelly
column4: Preheat oven to 350°.  Cream together 3 1/2 cups sugar  shortening  spices  salt and baking soda.  Add the molasses and blend well.  Gradually mix in the flour.  Then add the water to make a dough of pie crust consistency.  For each cookie  take 1 teaspoon of dough and roll it into a ball  then roll the ball in sugar.  Place each on ungreased cookie sheet  make a small indentation in the top of each ball and fill with a dot of jelly. Bake for 8 minutes.  Remove from oven and immediately sprinkle with sugar.  Cool before storing.

column3: 2  c. sugar1/2  c. milk1  stick margarine1/2  c. cocoa1/2  tsp. salt1  tsp. vanilla3  c. uncooked quick oats1/2  c. chopped walnuts1/2  c. coconut
column4: Mix sugar  milk  margarine and cocoa and boil 3 minutes.  Add salt  vanilla and oats.  Cool slightly.  Add walnuts and/or coconut.  Drop by spoonfuls on waxed paper.  Makes about 2 dozen.

column3: 1  pkg. 1 layer size yellow cake1/2  c. honey1/2  c. softened butter or margarine1 (7 oz.)  pkg. flaked coconut or toasted
column4: Prepare 1 package 1 layer size yellow cake mix according to package directions.  Pour batter into greased 9 x 9 x 2-inch pan. Bake at 350° for about 25 minutes  or until done.  Cool.      While cake is cooling  gradually add 1/2 cup honey to 1/2 cup softened butter or margarine  beating until fluffy.  Remove cake from pan.  Trim outside edges.  Cut into 2 x 1-inch bars.  Spread sides and top of each bar with honey-butter mixture.  Roll in 1 (7 ounce) package flaked coconut  toasted.  Top each with a strawberry.  Makes 2 1/2 dozen.

column3: 2  sticks oleo (1 c.) or softened1  c. white sugar1  c. lightly packed brown sugar (when measuring or spoon it lightly in cup)2  eggs2  tsp. vanilla1 1/2  c. flour1  tsp. baking powder1  tsp. soda2  c. old-fashioned oatmeal1  c. coconut2  c. Rice Krispies1  c. chopped nuts
column4: Preheat oven to 350°.  Thoroughly cream together oleo and sugars; add eggs and vanilla.  Mix well.  Sift together flour  baking powder and soda.  Combine flour and egg mixture; add oatmeal  coconut  cereal and nuts and mix well.  Drop by heaping teaspoonfuls about 2 inches apart on greased baking sheet.  Bake for about 10 minutes or until brown.  Remove from baking sheet immediately.  Makes 6 dozen.

column3: 1 1/2  c. plain flour2  tsp. baking powder1/2  tsp. salt3  c. corn flakes1  c. shortening1  c. white sugar1/2  c. brown sugar2  eggs or unbeaten1  tsp. vanilla1 1/2  c. coconut
column4: Add corn flakes to sifted dry ingredients.  Cream shortening; add sugars and blend well.  Add eggs  one at a time  beating well. Add vanilla  then flour and corn flake mixture.  Mix well.  Add coconut.  Drop by teaspoon.  Bake at 375° for 12 to 15 minutes. Makes 5 dozen cookies.

column3: 1 (6 oz.)  pkg. chocolate chips2  Tbsp. butter1  egg3  c. miniature colored marshmallows1/2  c. chopped nuts1  c. flaked coconut
column4: Melt chocolate chips and butter in top of double boiler.  Add the beaten egg and let cool.  Fold in marshmallows and nuts.  Turn out on waxed paper  which has been covered with coconut.  Form into 12 x 2 1/2-inch roll.  Wrap roll in waxed paper and freeze.  Slice and serve.

column3: 1  stick Imperial oleo1  lb. powdered sugar2  c. crunchy peanut butter3  c. Rice Krispies1/3  bar paraffin12  oz. semi-sweet chocolate chips
column4: Mix together 1 stick Imperial oleo  one pound sifted powdered sugar  2 cups crunchy peanut butter and 3 cups crushed Rice Krispies.  (Can use a rolling pin and a Ziploc bag to crush them.) Then roll all ingredients into small balls about the size of a half dollar; refrigerate overnight.  Next day  melt over hot water 1/3 bar paraffin and 12 ounces chocolate chips.  Dip each ball in chocolate and drain on waxed paper or wire rack.  Makes 100 balls.

column3: 2 1/4  c. chopped dates1/2  c. sugar1  c. water1  c. chopped nuts
column4: Cook dates  sugar  water.  Add nuts when cool.      Combine all ingredients for dough.  Roll dough out and spread with date mixture.  Roll up in pinwheel.  Place in wax paper. Leave in refrigerator overnight.  Slice  then bake in 350° oven until lightly browned.

column3: 1  c. shortening1  c. light brown sugar3  eggs or well beaten1 1/2  c. molasses6  c. bread flour1 1/2  Tbsp. ginger2 1/4  tsp. salt1  tsp. cinnamon1 1/2  tsp. soda
column4: Cream shortening and sugar; add eggs and molasses.  Stir dry ingredients together and add.  Chill.  Roll out not too thin.  Bake at 350° until dry  not crisp.  Makes enough dough for many shaped cookies.  Frost  if desired.

column3: 1  c. butter or margarine2  c. brown sugar or packed2  eggs1/2  c. cool coffee4 1/2  c. sifted all-purpose flour1  tsp. baking soda1/2  tsp. salt1/2  tsp. nutmeg1 1/2  tsp. cinnamon2  c. raisins1 1/2  c. chopped walnuts
column4: Heat oven to 400°.  Beat butter  sugar and eggs together until well blended.  Stir in coffee.  Sift flour  baking soda  salt  nutmeg and cinnamon together.  Blend into shortening mixture. Stir in raisins and walnuts.  Drop mixture by rounded teaspoonfuls  about 2 inches apart  onto greased cookie sheets.  Bake 8 minutes or until cookies feel almost firm.  Cool.  Makes 6 dozen.

column3: 1  c. shortening1  c. white sugar1  c. brown sugar2  eggs2  c. flour1/2  tsp. baking powder1  tsp. soda1  tsp. salt2  c. quick oats2  c. Rice Krispies1  c. coconut1  tsp. vanilla
column4: Cream shortening and sugars.  Add eggs.  Add flour  baking powder  soda and salt and work in oats  Rice Krispies  coconut and vanilla.  Mix thoroughly until mixture is a stiff dough.  Mold into small balls and press down on greased cookie sheets with fork. Bake in 350° oven until brown.

column3: 1/4  c. butter or softened1 small  pkg. pistachio instant pudding1 1/3  c. baking mix1  egg1  Tbsp. sugar  confectioners sugar frosting or tinted green
column4: Cream butter and pudding mix.  Add baking mix  egg and sugar; mix well.  Roll on lightly floured board to 3/8-inch thickness. Cut with shamrock-shaped cookie cutter.  Bake on lightly greased cookie sheet at 350° for 9 to 10 minutes.  Cool on wire racks.  Top with frosting.  Yields 1 1/2 dozen.

column3: 12  oz. (2 c.) semi-sweet chocolate chips1  oz. unsweetened chocolate or finely chopped2  Tbsp. unsalted butter1  tsp. instant coffee powder3  large eggs1  c. plus 2 Tbsp. sugar1  tsp. vanilla1/2  c. plus 2 Tbsp. flour1/2  tsp. baking powder
column4: Preheat oven to 350°.  In top of double boiler over hot  not simmering  water  melt together the chocolates and butter.  Add coffee powder and stir well.  Remove from heat and cool to room temperature.      In large bowl  beat eggs until foamy.  Add sugar 2 tablespoons at a time while beating; continue to beat for 2 minutes until light and fluffy.  Add vanilla and cooled chocolate mixture.  Mix well.      Sift flour and baking powder into egg/chocolate mixture.  Mix well.  Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls onto 2 ungreased baking sheets.  Bake for 8 to 10 minutes until cookies are just set. Don't overbake.  Remove from oven; cool 5 minutes.  Transfer to rack.  Cool well.  Makes 3 dozen.

column3: 2  c. flour1  c. quick oats1  tsp. baking soda1  tsp. cinnamon1/2  tsp. salt1  c. butter or softened1  c. brown sugar1  c. granulated sugar1  egg1  tsp. vanilla1  c. pumpkin1  c. chocolate chips
column4: Combine flour  oats  soda  cinnamon and salt.  Cream butter; add sugars and beat well.  Add egg and vanilla; mix well. Alternately add dry ingredients and pumpkin  mixing well.  Stir in chips.  For each cookie drop 1/4 cup dough onto greased cookie sheet; spread into pumpkin shape.  Add a bit more to form stem. Bake at 350° for 20 to 25 minutes  until cookies are lightly browned.  Remove from sheet and cool.  Can be decorated using icing  candies  nuts or more chips.  Makes about 20 cookies.

column3: whole graham crackers2  sticks oleo1  egg2  Tbsp. milk1  c. sugar1/2  c. chopped nuts1  c. coconut1  c. graham cracker crumbs
column4: Line pan with butter (8 x 8-inch pan for regular recipe and 9 x 12-inch pan for 1 1/2 recipes).  Cover with whole graham crackers. Melt 2 sticks oleo.  Mix egg  milk and sugar together; add to melted oleo.  Bring to boil.  (Stir constantly to prevent burning.) Remove from heat; add nuts  coconut and crumbs.  Pour over the layer of graham crackers in the pan.  Top with whole graham crackers.  Pour icing over the mixture.  Chill 5 hours.  Freezes very well.  Make it the day before or make it ahead and freeze to use later.      Combine all ingredients and pour atop graham crackers.

column3: 1  c. butter or softened1  c. powdered sugar1  tsp. vanilla extract1 1/4  c. flour1  c. quick cooking oats  chocolate raisins
column4: In small bowl  cream butter and sugar.  Add extract.  Stir in flour and oats.  Stir in chocolate raisins.  Shape into 2 rolls  each 1 1/2-inches in diameter.  Wrap in waxed paper and chill. (Can make drop cookies.)  Heat oven to 350°.  Cut rolls into 1/4-inch slices and place on ungreased cookie sheet.  Bake 10 to 12 minutes.  Makes 6 to 7 dozen.

column3: 6  to 8 large size bananas or cut in half2/3  c. vegetable shortening1 (12 oz.) or 2 (6 oz.)  pkg. semi-sweet chocolate chips
column4: You will need 12 to 16 wooden sticks.      Place wooden sticks in peeled bananas that are cut in halves. Place on waxed paper covered cookie sheet and freeze overnight. Cover with waxed paper or place in plastic bag.  Melt shortening and chocolate in double boiler over hot  not boiling  water. Remove from heat and place or dip bananas in hot chocolate. Chocolate will harden almost immediately on frozen bananas.  Place on waxed paper covered cookie sheet and place each banana in plastic bag; re-freeze.

column3: 2  c. white sugar1/2  c. shortening2  eggs2  tsp. soda1  tsp. salt2  c. flour2  tsp. cinnamon4  c. apples or peeled and finely chopped1  c. chopped walnuts
column4: Cream sugar and shortening together; add eggs and dry ingredients.  Then blend in apples and walnuts.  Pour batter into 9 x 13-inch pan.  Bake 1 hour at 350° in a 9 x 13-inch pan.      Mix sauce ingredients together and bring to a boil.  Serve warm over apple cake and top with whipped cream.

column3: 3/4  c. white Karo3/4  c. brown sugar12  oz. peanut butter5  c. Special K cereal
column4: Heat Karo and brown sugar on stove.  Stir to dissolve sugar  but do not let it bubble.  Remove from stove and add peanut butter  stirring to mix well.  Pour over Special K cereal and mix well. Butter a 9 x 12-inch pan.  With hands buttered also  pat mixture into pan.      Melt chips together.  Spread on top of cereal mixture.  Cool and cut in squares.

column3: 1/2  c. evaporated milk1/2  c. margarine2  c. sugar1/2  tsp. salt1/2  c. cocoa2  tsp. vanilla1/2  c. peanut butter3  c. oatmeal
column4: Mix evaporated milk  margarine  sugar  salt and cocoa in medium saucepan; bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute  stirring constantly.  Remove from heat; add vanilla.  Allow to cool for about 5 minutes.  Stir in 1/2 cup peanut butter and 3 cups oatmeal. Drop by teaspoonfuls on waxed paper.  Allow to harden.

column3: 1  c. softened butter1/2  c. confectioners sugar1  tsp. almond extract2 to 3  Tbsp. milk2 1/2  c. sifted cake flour1/2  c. finely chopped pecans6  oz. jar maraschino cherries or drained and cut in half
column4: Mix butter  sugar  extract and milk.  Blend in flour and mix in nuts.  Chill dough.  Heat oven to 400°.  Roll dough into 1-inch balls and insert cherry half into center of ball.  Bake 10 to 12 minutes on ungreased baking sheets until set  not brown.  While warm  roll in confectioners sugar  cool and roll again.

column3: 1  egg or beaten1  Tbsp. flour1  c. sugar1/4  lb. or 1/2 c. melted butter1  c. quick cooking oats1/4  tsp. salt1/4  tsp. baking powder1/2  tsp. vanilla
column4: Combine all ingredients.  Drop very small amount of dough (1/4 teaspoon  as it spreads thin) on greased and floured wax paper-lined cookie sheet.  Bake at 350° for about 5 minutes until slightly brown at edges.  If underdone  will not come off paper. Allow cookies to cool on paper before removing.  Makes 80 to 100 cookies.  Cookies look like beige bits of lace.

column3: 1  can Eagle Brand condensed milk1/3  c. smooth peanut butter2  c. Bisquick1  tsp. vanilla  granulated sugar for coating1  pkg. chocolate kisses
column4: Beat Eagle Brand and peanut butter until smooth.  Add Bisquick and vanilla and mix.  Form 1-inch balls.  Roll in granulated sugar. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet.  Bake at 375° for 6 to 8 minutes.  Remove from oven.  Press chocolate kiss into center of each cookie immediately.  Remove from pan and allow to cool.

column3: 1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese2  sticks butter2  c. flour  strawberry jelly or jam  powdered sugar
column4: Mix together thoroughly cream cheese  butter and flour.  Form into ball and refrigerate overnight.  Leave at room temperature about 1 hour.  Roll out thin on lightly floured board.  Cut into about 3-inch rounds.  Fill with 1 teaspoon jam or jelly (your desired flavor).  Fold over and seal edges by crimping with fork. Bake on cookie sheet at 375° for 20 minutes.  Cool and dust with powdered sugar.

column3: 20  to 30 rose leaves1  (8 oz.) milk chocolate candy bar
column4: To decorate cake  gather 20 to 30 rose leaves from garden. Wash thoroughly and dry leaves.  Melt an 8 ounce milk chocolate candy bar in double boiler.  Lay waxed paper on cookie sheet.  Hold leaf in hand; put chocolate on the underneath side with knife or paint brush.  Put in refrigerator.  When chocolate has hardened  peel off rose leaves.  Place chocolate leaves in storage container in refrigerator until needed for decorating.

column3: 1  c. flour1/2  tsp. salt1  c. butter1 (3 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese1  can apricot filling1  Tbsp. powdered sugar (optional)
column4: Blend flour  salt and butter until crumbly (like pie dough). Blend in cream cheese.  Shape dough into 5-inch square.  Wrap in plastic and chill about 2 hours.  Roll 1/4 of the dough into 12-inch square  cut dough into 2-inch squares and put 1/2 teaspoon apricot filling on each square; fold over opposite corners.  Bake on ungreased cookie sheet 8 to 10 minutes at 350°.  Sprinkle with powdered sugar  if desired.

column3: 1  c. butter or margarine3/4  c. firmly packed brown sugar1  unbeaten egg yolk2 1/4  c. sifted flour
column4: Cream butter and gradually add brown sugar; cream well.  Blend in egg yolk  then add flour.  Stir until mixture forms a dough. Chill if necessary.  Shape into balls size of a marble.  Place on ungreased baking sheets and flatten to 1/8-inch thickness with palm of hand.  Make a design by pressing with fork in one direction. Bake at 325° for 8 to 10 minutes until cookies begin to brown.  Remove from sheet while warm.  Place flat sides of 2 cookies together with frosting.      Slightly brown butter or margarine in saucepan.  Remove from heat and blend in powdered sugar.  Gradually add vanilla and cream until spreading consistency.

column3: 1  c. Crisco1  c. brown sugar1  c. white sugar2  eggs or unbeaten1  c. nuts1  tsp. vanilla3  c. flour1  tsp. salt1  tsp. soda1  tsp. baking powder
column4: Cream Crisco and sugars; add eggs  nuts and vanilla.  Sift flour  salt  soda and baking powder together.  Stir into batter and mix well.  Divide batter in half and shape into 2 rolls. Refrigerate overnight.  Slice in 1/4-inch slices and place on greased and floured cookie sheet.  Bake at 350° for 10 to 12 minutes.

column3: 1/2  c. sliced strawberries2  Tbsp. sugar1  Tbsp. cocoa1  c. milk1/2  c. chilled carbonated beverage
column4: Combine strawberries  sugar  cocoa and half of the milk in blender container; blend well.  Add remaining milk and carbonated beverage; blend.  Garnish with dollop of whipped cream or ice cream and a strawberry  if desired.  Yields two 8-ounce servings.

column3: 15  chocolate creme-filled cookies2  Tbsp. melted butter1  pt. softened ice cream  about 24 Bonbons brand ice cream nuggets  whipped cream  chocolate syrup
column4: Crush cookies.  Combine with butter.  Press into buttered 8-inch pie plate.  Bake in 350° oven 8 to 10 minutes.  Cool.      Spoon ice cream into pie shell.  Cover surface with Bonbons nuggets  gently pressing into ice cream.  Freeze.  Before serving  cover pie with whipped cream and drizzle with chocolate syrup. Serve at once.  Premade pie shell may be used instead of cookies.

column3: 1/2  c. egg whites (3 eggs)1 1/4  c. sugar1/4  tsp. salt1/3  c. Amaretto liqueur3 1/4  oz. flaked coconut4  oz. almonds or finely chopped
column4: Beat egg whites until stiff.  Then gradually beat in sugar  1 tablespoon at a time  until stiff and glossy.  Add salt.  Gradually beat in Amaretto.  Fold in coconut and almonds.  Line cookie sheets with foil.  Drop mixture by heaping teaspoonfuls onto foil.  Bake at 325° for 20 minutes.  Cool cookies on foil.  Store in airtight container.  Makes 4 dozen.

column3: 1  stick butter or oleo1  tsp. salt3  c. powdered sugar1/4  c. chocolate syrup1/4  c. milk2  tsp. vanilla1  c. pecans
column4: Mix softened butter or oleo.  Add salt  powdered sugar  chocolate syrup and milk; beat until fluffy with electric beater. Add vanilla and pecans; continue beating until nuts have been properly mixed into the frosting.

column3: 1/2  c. butter1  c. sugar1  tsp. lemon juice1/2  tsp. grated lemon rind1  egg2 1/4  c. sifted flour2  tsp. baking powder1  tsp. cinnamon1/4  tsp. nutmeg1/4  c. milk1  c. grated carrot1  c. huckleberries
column4: Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.  Add lemon juice  rind and egg and beat until well blended.  Sift dry ingredients together and add to creamed mixture.  Add milk.  Stir in carrot and huckleberries.  Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls on greased cookie sheet.  Bake at 375° for 12 to 15 minutes or until done.  Yields about 4 dozen.

column3: 1 1/2  c. water1 1/2  c. raisins1  tsp. soda1 1/2  c. sugar1  c. shortening3  eggs1/4  tsp. salt3  c. flour1 1/2  tsp. baking powder1  tsp. cinnamon
column4: Combine water and raisins; cook until water is absorbed.  Add the soda.  Cream together sugar and shortening; add the eggs.  Mix together salt  flour  baking powder and cinnamon.  Add creamed mixture; add raisins last.  Form into balls and flatten with bottom of a glass dipped in sugar.  Bake in 375° oven about 10 minutes.

column3: 3/4  lb. butter or 3 sticks oleo1 1/3  c. sugar1  egg1 1/2  tsp. vanilla3  c. sifted flour1  tsp. soda1/2  tsp. salt
column4: Mix butter and sugar until creamy.  Add egg and vanilla and beat well.  Add sifted dry ingredients and mix well.  Roll into small balls and place on ungreased cookie sheet.  Dampen cloth and put over small drinking glass.  Dip in white sugar and use to flatten cookie balls.  Bake at 325° for 15 minutes or until done.

column3: 1 1/2  c. oleo1 1/2  c. sugar3  eggs3/4  tsp. lemon flavoring3/4  tsp. vanilla1/2  tsp. butter flavoring4 1/2  c. flour1 1/2  tsp. soda1/2  tsp. salt3/4  c. frozen lemonade or thawed
column4: Cream together oleo and sugar.  Add all remaining ingredients and chill 1 hour.  Drop by teaspoon on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350° for 12 minutes.      Combine powdered sugar and butter; use lemonade for liquid.

column3: 2  c. margarine1 1/2  c. brown sugar1 1/2  c. granulated sugar4  eggs2  tsp. vanilla5  c. flour1  tsp. salt2  tsp. soda1 (12 oz.)  pkg. chocolate chips
column4: Cream together margarine and sugars; add eggs and vanilla. Beat until fluffy.  Sift together flour  salt and soda; stir into mixture.  Add chocolate chips.  Drop by teaspoons on ungreased cookie sheet.  Bake at 375° for 8 to 10 minutes.  Yields 8 dozen.

column3: 2 1/4  c. flour1  tsp. soda1  tsp. salt1  c. softened shortening3/4  c. granulated sugar3/4  c. firmly packed brown sugar1  tsp. vanilla1/2  tsp. water2  eggs12  oz. pkg. butterscotch morsels1  c. chopped nuts
column4: Sift together flour  soda and salt.  Set aside.  Combine shortening  granulated sugar  brown sugar  vanilla and water; beat until creamy.  Beat in eggs.  Add flour mixture; mix well.  Stir in butterscotch morsels and coarsely chopped nuts.  Drop by well rounded 1/2 teaspoonfuls onto greased cookie sheets.  Bake at 375° for 10 to 12 minutes.

column3: 12  oz. jar crunchy peanut butter or melted2  sticks margarine1  box confectioners sugar12  oz. bag chocolate chips1/2  block paraffin
column4: Melt peanut butter in 2 sticks of butter or margarine.  Stir in the box of confectioners sugar.  Stir until well mixed.  Form into balls.  Put on waxed paper on a cookie sheet.  Place the balls in the refrigerator until chilled and firm.  Melt the chocolate chips and the paraffin.  When the balls are chilled  using toothpicks  dip each in the chocolate mixture and place in the refrigerator to set chocolate.  Can be frozen.
